text.*:
Prix Versailles
Awarded for stores, hotels and restaurants architectures around the world
First awarded 2015
Website prix-versailles.com

The Prix Versailles is an annual award dedicated to commercial architecture which was inaugurated in 2015. Discerned at the headquarters of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) in Paris, it encompasses several categories, with the winners being selected by an independent judges panel. It is the world architecture award for stores, hotels and restaurants.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Purpose and process
  • 2 Judges
  • 3 Winners
    • 3.1 Prix Versailles 2015
    • 3.2 Prix Versailles 2016
    • 3.3 Prix Versailles 2017 – World winners
    • 3.4 Prix Versailles 2017 – Continental winners
    • 3.5 Prix Versailles 2018 – World winners
    • 3.6 Prix Versailles 2018 – Continental winners
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Purpose and process[edit]

Following a call for submissions, this award singles out the architects and owners of shops and stores, hotels and restaurants around the world that are found to be particularly remarkable, from a perspective of their exterior architecture and their interior design. The prix focuses on commercial buildings, with the clear aim of fostering a better mix of the economic and cultural sectors.[2] Irina Bokova, Director-General of UNESCO, declared on 19 June 2015, "The Prix Versailles is one of the ways to shine light on the intersection between creation, art and economics".[3]

Winners[edit]

Prix Versailles 2015[edit]

The awards were conferred at UNESCO Headquarters on 19 June 2015.[9][10] After a first edition specific to France, the prix was expanded to the rest of the world in 2016.

Prix or special prize Category Project Location Country Architect or designer Country
Prix Versailles Galeries Lafayette, Centre Bourse[11][12] Marseille France Moatti – Rivière[13] France
Special prize Interior Brasserie Les Haras[14] Strasbourg France Jouin Manku France
Special prize Exterior Repetto shop, rue de Charonne Paris France
Special prize Services Musée des Confluences shop Lyon France Julien Kolmont de Rogier[15] France

Prix Versailles 2017 – World winners[edit]

The awards were conferred at UNESCO Headquarters on 12 May 2017. Twelve world winners were recognized in four categories, selected from amongst 70 continental winners from 35 countries.[23][24][25]

Prix Versailles 2018 – Continental winners[edit]

The continental awards were conferred:

  • on 14 April 2018 in Santiago de Chile (Castillo Hidalgo)[29] for the Central America, the South and the Caribbean region and the North America region; [30][31]
  • on 20 April 2018 in Beijing (Miyun District) for the Central Asia and the Northeast region and the South Asia and the Pacific region;[32]
  • on 26 April 2018 in Algiers (Centre international de conférences) for the Africa and West Asia region and the Europe region.[33][34]
